obfuscation: ﻿ Taboo or Not Taboo Shirley E. Peckham argues in her article `` Cleaning up the language '' that children of today are using swear words besides much in their every-day conversations with each other .
original:
﻿ Taboo or Not Taboo  Shirley E. 
Peckham argues in her article "Cleaning up the language" that children of today are using swear words too much in their every-day conversations with each other.

obfuscation: She is alarmed by this discovery since her own upbringing taught her that this is bad behavior .
original: She is alarmed by this discovery since her own upbringing taught her that this is bad behaviour.

obfuscation: She says that `` If children are to be allowed to continue this foul and anti-social behavior way for much longer it will become general practice for all and everyone in future years to behave in like way . ''
original: She says that "If children are to be allowed to continue this foul and anti-social behaviour way for much longer it will become general practice for all and everyone in future years to behave in like way."

obfuscation: I disagree with her ; I actually do not believe that our language is in any danger of becoming ruined by a frequent use of swear words .
original: I disagree with her; I really do not believe that our language is in any danger of becoming ruined by a frequent use of swear words.

obfuscation: People have been swearing throughout time and that has not made our present language any worse .
original: People have been swearing throughout time and that has not made our present language any worse.

obfuscation: I am not concerned with children 's swearing , I think that most children know when it is all properly to use swear words and when it is not .
original: I am not concerned with children's swearing, I think that most children know when it is all right to use swear words and when it is not.

obfuscation: Peckham claims , as mentioned , that if children are allowed to swear , our language will in the future be ruined and swearing will become general practice .
original: Peckham claims, as mentioned, that if children are allowed to swear, our language will in the future be ruined and swearing will become general practice.

obfuscation: This can not be true , since swearing is an old phenomenon and people of today use full language .
original: This cannot be true, since swearing is an old phenomenon and people of today use good language.

obfuscation: Peckham does not seem to understand that swear words have a specific function in our society ; people use them to show emotion and in some cases to state their identity .
original: Peckham does not seem to understand that swear words have a specific function in our society; people use them to show emotion and in some cases to state their identity.

obfuscation: If a particular swear word is used frequently by a large group of people , the word will after some time lose most of its erstwhile `` power '' .
original: If a particular swear word is used frequently by a large group of people, the word will after some time lose most of its former "power".

obfuscation: If that happens a new swear word will be created ; taken from an area in society which is taboo .
original: If that happens a new swear word will be created; taken from an area in society which is taboo.

obfuscation: thus there will always be swear words and people who use them .
original: So there will always be swear words and people who use them.

obfuscation: Just because swear words are indeed forbidden , some young people like to use them .
original: Just because swear words are indeed forbidden, some young people like to use them.

obfuscation: Peckham believes that children swear in order to feel large by it .
original: Peckham believes that children swear in order to feel big by it.

obfuscation: But children and adolescent swear as a sort of revolt .
original: But children and adolescent swear as a sort of revolt.

obfuscation: '' To revolt '' is something most of us do at that age , and this kind of revolt has to be considered as quite harmless .
original: "To revolt" is something most of us do at that age, and this kind of revolt has to be considered as quite harmless.

obfuscation: Peckham also says that `` children these days do not seem to know what speaking normally and decently is '' .
original: Peckham also says that "children these days do not seem to know what speaking normally and decently is".

obfuscation: I think they do .
original: I believe they do.

obfuscation: As noted , swearing has a communicative function as well .
original: As mentioned, swearing has a communicative function as well.

obfuscation: When children and adolescents talk , they wish to `` spice '' their language with different sorts of effects , to really clarify the emotional content of what they are saying .
original: When children and adolescents talk, they like to "spice" their language with different sorts of effects, to really clarify the emotional content of what they are saying.

obfuscation: This kind of talk is often used among peers , not when a child is addressing a parent , a teacher , or any early adult .
original: This kind of talk is often used among peers, not when a child is addressing a parent, a teacher, or any other adult.

obfuscation: Nor does a child use swear words in their written texts in school , because he or she realises that swear words do not fit in in that context .
original: Nor does a child use swear words in their written texts in school, because he or she realises that swear words do not fit in in that context.

obfuscation: Peckham had over-heard a conversation between young boys at the railway station , she had not talked to any of them herself , nor did any of the boys address her when they talked .
original: Peckham had over-heard a conversation between young boys at the railway station, she had not talked to any of them herself, nor did any of the boys address her when they talked.

obfuscation: By this fact we can draw the conclusion that Peckham has no right to blame children of not being able to speak normally .
original: By this fact we can draw the conclusion that Peckham has no right to blame children of not being able to speak normally.

obfuscation: I believe that Shirley E. Peckham is exaggerating ; children 's swearing is not really a big trouble , and our language is not in any danger of becoming ruined by a frequent use of swear words .
original:
I believe that Shirley E. 
Peckham is exaggerating; children's swearing is not really a big problem, and our language is not in any danger of becoming ruined by a frequent use of swear words.

obfuscation: We have been swearing throughout time and will credibly continue doing so .
original: We have been swearing throughout time and will probably continue doing so.

obfuscation: And I am not concerned with children 's swearing as long as they follow `` the rules '' .
original: And I am not concerned with children's swearing as long as they follow "the rules".

obfuscation: They know how to talk decently and they usually do .
original: They know how to talk decently and they usually do.

obfuscation: But if you over-hear a conversation between them full of swear words , you should not be alarmed , not even shocked .
original: But if you over-hear a conversation between them full of swear words, you should not be alarmed, not even shocked.

obfuscation: When they have grown up , they will talk just like you .
original: When they have grown up, they will talk just like you.
